FAQ





 















Request Assistance Now












Assistance when you need it the most
SJSU Cares provides resources and services for SJSU students facing many kinds of
                                    financial crisis. If you’re having trouble paying for food, housing or other bills,
                                    due to an unforeseen crisis come to us to get the help you need.







Housing Assistance







Housing insecurity is a real issue among students.
If you find yourself living in shelters, parks, motels or cars, or temporarily couch-surfing
                                    with other people because you have nowhere else to go,  SJSU Cares provides support
                                    for students who lack stable, regular and adequate housing. 
Request Assistance Now











Emergency Bed Program
Beds are currently available for up to 28 nights per bed.  If you're struggling with
                                 housing, reach out to a Case Manager by requesting assistance to discuss your individual needs.




Rapid Rehousing
Are you homeless or at risk of becoming homeless soon? Currently enrolled & living
                                 in an unsafe environment and have nowhere else to go? You may be eligible for the
                                 Rapid Rehousing, a housing assistance program in partnership with the Bill Wilson
                                 Center. Complete a Request for Assistance form, or consider using our drop-in hours every Tue 1-2PM via Zoom. This is a State funded pilot program with a planned ending June 30, 2023.






Food Assistance







Are you finding yourself struggling to afford food?
You are not alone. SJSU Cares has two great programs to help you get the food you
                                    need to focus on your education: the Spartan Food Pantry and Calfresh.











Spartan Food Pantry
No student should ever go hungry. This full service walk-in pantry offers perishable
                                 goods, fresh produce, and refrigerated goods at SJSU.




CalFresh
Get help applying for CalFresh, which provides a monthly cash supplement loaded onto
                                 a debit card to use for buying groceries.














Emergency assistance
SJSU Cares also provides help after natural disasters and other emergency situations,
                                    from floods and fires to burglaries and break-ins. If you are in need of assistance,
                                    please submit a Request for Assistance form.
Request Assistance Now















How can a Case Manager help?
A Case Manager will meet with you (either in person or over the phone) to understand
                                    the circumstances surrounding your financial crisis—and then work directly with you
                                    to find resources on campus or in the community to help you succeed.
Connect with a Case Manager















We are here to help.
No student should have to worry about where they will sleep at night or when their
                                    next meal will be. Request assistance now, and SJSU Cares will be there for you.
Request Assistance Now
